document.bingtitle: Secret Service Seizes Million-Dollar Bill Tracts from Christian ...
document.webtitle: Secret Service Seizes Million-Dollar Bill Tracts from Christian Ministry
document.description: If you want Million Dollar bill tracts, you had better order them pronto. ... on a table or on a counter in, say, a shopping area or a fast food restaurant.
document.body:
Free Republic Browse · Search News/Activism Topics · Post Article
Skip to comments. Secret Service Seizes Million-Dollar Bill Tracts from Christian Ministry E-mail | Friday, June 2, 2006 | Staff
Posted on 06/02/2006 3:06:53 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger
The Secret Service seized a large supply of Million Dollar bill tracts from The Great News Network in Texas. The tracts, manufactured to look like large bills, have Christian gospel messages printed on the back, and are designed to be distributed as eye-catching tools for Christian evangelism. The Secret Service explained that an individual in North Carolina attempted to deposit the bills in their account, and as a result, the ministry was threatened with arrest if they did not surrender their supply of tracts. According to an e-mail from the ministry, authorities intend to seize the supply of tracts from the California location as well.
TOPICS: Your Opinion/Questions KEYWORDS: counterfeit ; kirkcameron ; kookykirk ; raycomfort ; snakeoil ; wayofthemaster Navigation: use the links below to view more comments. first 1-50 , 51-100 , 101-103 next last I wrote the body of the"article"myself based on the text of an e-mail I just received: Today (Friday, June 2nd) the Secret Service seized a large supply of our Million Dollar Bill tracts from The Great News Network in Texas. They told them that someone in North Carolina tried to deposit one in their bank, and that if they didn't give up their supply, they would arrest them. Then they said they are going to seize our supply in California. If you want Million Dollar bill tracts, you had better order them pronto. You may still want to order them, but at last check, the link did not work.
1 posted on 06/02/2006 3:06:54 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger [ Post Reply | Private Reply | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger What kind of idiot would try to deposit one of these into his/her bank? Oh, North Carolina? Bless their heart...
2 posted on 06/02/2006 3:09:04 PM PDT by TommyDale (Stop the Nifongery!) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger Can you counterfeit a denomination of bill that doesn't exist?
3 posted on 06/02/2006 3:09:19 PM PDT by atomicpossum (Replies must follow approved guidelines or you will be kill-filed without appeal.) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: atomicpossum It's not even the size of a regular dollar bill. They can't do it legally unless the bills are too big.
4 posted on 06/02/2006 3:12:19 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger ("Good guys"aren't always"nice guys".) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 3 | View Replies ] To: TommyDale Oh, this is funny.. a woman was arrested in Mohave Valley night before last trying to pay for fuel with a million dollar bill.... she told the police she knew it was phoney, but she needed it to put fuel into her stolen 2006 Lincoln.
5 posted on 06/02/2006 3:12:28 PM PDT by Arizona Carolyn [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 2 | View Replies ] To: TommyDale Well .. I'm wondering what kind of idiot would propose such a track in the first place. Duplicating a likeness of our money is a FELONY .. so whoever thought up this idea doesn't know the law very well.
6 posted on 06/02/2006 3:14:34 PM PDT by CyberAnt (Drive-by Media: Fake news, fake documents, fake polls) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 2 | View Replies ] Comment #7 Removed by Moderator To: CyberAnt Duplicating a likeness of our money is a FELONY .. so whoever thought up this idea doesn't know the law very well. 1 - there is no such thing as a million dollar bill. 2 - it was 'oversized', not bill size. 8 posted on 06/02/2006 3:16:24 PM PDT by AgThorn (Bush is my president, but he needs to protect our borders. FIRST, before any talk of"Amnesty.") [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 6 | View Replies ] To: Arizona Carolyn I'd like to see someone try to make change from that.
9 posted on 06/02/2006 3:16:34 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger ("Good guys"aren't always"nice guys".) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 5 | View Replies ] Comment #10 Removed by Moderator To: DaveLoneRanger A bunch of folks were distributing these at the Main St. Arts Festival in Fort Worth in April. I told the guy who gave me mine that it was a felony to even attempt to reproduce a facsimile of our currency. He said they had that all worked out with the government. 11 posted on 06/02/2006 3:19:15 PM PDT by sinkspur ( Don Cheech. Vito Corleone would like to meet you......Vito Corleone.....) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: CyberAnt Someone should tell that to these guys .
12 posted on 06/02/2006 3:19:56 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger ("Good guys"aren't always"nice guys".) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 6 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger I'm thinkin' the Secret Service is going after the wrong folks here. For starters, the guy who attenmpted to deposit fradulent funds. Check also to see how bright the bank clerk is...
13 posted on 06/02/2006 3:20:05 PM PDT by Mrs. Darla Ruth Schwerin [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: Arizona Carolyn I remember back in the early 90's, when the Clinton $3 Bill was a popular gag. I would wrap one of the phony $3 bills around a couple of $1 bills as tips to smart aleck car attendants or waiters.
14 posted on 06/02/2006 3:20:46 PM PDT by TommyDale (Stop the Nifongery!) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 5 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger Why are you telling me ..??
Why aren't you telling the Secret Service ..??
15 posted on 06/02/2006 3:21:11 PM PDT by CyberAnt (Drive-by Media: Fake news, fake documents, fake polls) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 12 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger This is absolutely riduculous. How can you make a big deal of this when there's no such thing as a 1Million dollar bill?? The gov't ought to leave these people alone! It's not their fault that dimwit tried to deposit it! SS, go home, read the tract and leave 'em alone!!
16 posted on 06/02/2006 3:30:37 PM PDT by WKUHilltopper [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger
17 posted on 06/02/2006 3:31:29 PM PDT by Diddle E. Squat [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: CyberAnt This has been done by Gospel tract ministries for at least 50 years, and probably longer. You can still TODAY order tracts that appear, at a distance, to be folded $5.00 bills. The idea is to leave one on a table or on a counter in, say, a shopping area or a fast food restaurant.
When someone picks it up and unfolds it, it is only about 3 inches long altogether! Once it's within 12 inches of your eyes, it is obvious that it is not genuine. On the inside is a message and/or some Scripture verses.
I never heard of the Treasury Department complaining about these. I don't believe that it is illegal, myself. And I think it was ridiculous for the Secret Service to waste time to go and confiscate the literature. 18 posted on 06/02/2006 3:31:59 PM PDT by Free Baptist [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 6 | View Replies ] To: CyberAnt Because making products that look like money is not illegal, as long as there are clear indications that the money is not truly intended as counterfeit. I just finished a ten-minute search (FindLaw.com, google, SecretService.gov, etc.) for the statues on illegal tender, but couldn't find size requirements. I know somehow, it's legal. I imagine they'll probably give them back after a while.
19 posted on 06/02/2006 3:34:17 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger ("Good guys"aren't always"nice guys".) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 15 | View Replies ] To: atomicpossum There's a fellow who can draw really really well - and not surprisingly has been in trouble before with bogus bills. As I heard it he doesn't actually try to spend them as currency, but most people (at a diner, say, for not too unreasonable purchases) will trade-in-kind because they are so neat. Read about it in one of the coin magazines or wherever, can't remember.
As I understand it part of the problem with counterfeiting - the US outsourced a lot of heavy industries, and with it apparently intaglio press, and even by god, the sort of machine that will make a seamless beret as per spec. Anyway - through a circuitous pipeline the wrong folks got a hold of the right machinery and paper, and ink presumably, to make completely undetectable forgeries. Years ago I heard that fully 70 per cent of the actual cash is outside the U.S. of America. One time, I actually had a street vendor try to refuse a $100 bill because it was a little bit wrinkled, or a corner was bent. US dollars make up a significant part of people's savings throughout the world so it has to be made good - and one of the ways is to maintain the security through modernization.
20 posted on 06/02/2006 3:35:23 PM PDT by Freedom4US [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 3 | View Replies ] To: friendlyadvice No, I'm not kidding. Was on our news every hour on the hour yesterday.
21 posted on 06/02/2006 3:40:57 PM PDT by Arizona Carolyn [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 10 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger Christian Evangelist Ray Comfort (with buddy Kirk Cameron) has been promoting the use of these tracts on their TV show for some time now. 22 posted on 06/02/2006 3:44:29 PM PDT by Tamar1973 (Don't argue with an idiot; people watching may not be able to tell the difference.) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: CyberAnt Come on now. We all had fake money as kids and what about monopoly money? I don't think it is illegal to make obviously fake money. 23 posted on 06/02/2006 3:44:49 PM PDT by gocats [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 6 | View Replies ] To: Tamar1973 Yeah I know. I'm a big fan of the show. Judging by the keywords inserted on this thread, there are a few Philistines who aren't.
24 posted on 06/02/2006 3:47:36 PM PDT by DaveLoneRanger ("Good guys"aren't always"nice guys".) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 22 | View Replies ] To: WKUHilltopper Really! I think the SS needs to spend some time interviewing the N.Y. State Comptroller, rather than on this nonsense......
25 posted on 06/02/2006 3:48:52 PM PDT by Frank_2001 [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 16 | View Replies ] To: atomicpossum I can see it now."Well gee skeeter, looks 'n feels pretty real to me. I guess we aughta give this feller a few suitcases of twenties. Are twenties alright mister?"
26 posted on 06/02/2006 3:50:08 PM PDT by RobRoy [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 3 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger "I'd like to see someone try to make change from that."
'Spechially for a latte.
27 posted on 06/02/2006 3:52:53 PM PDT by RobRoy [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 9 | View Replies ] To: friendlyadvice I thought Treasury agents dealt with money issues??
28 posted on 06/02/2006 3:53:06 PM PDT by cajun-jack [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 7 | View Replies ] To: Diddle E. Squat You forgot one!
29 posted on 06/02/2006 3:54:43 PM PDT by Sarajevo [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 17 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger This is probably a hoax . If not though, hmm. God works in mysterious ways. Maybe someone at the shredding machine will get saved:') 30 posted on 06/02/2006 3:55:56 PM PDT by CindyDawg [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: atomicpossum If you intended to pass it as legal tender, probably. 31 posted on 06/02/2006 3:56:51 PM PDT by 1rudeboy [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 3 | View Replies ] To: gocats I don't think it is illegal to make obviously fake money. But did you try to buy something with it? That is the question. 32 posted on 06/02/2006 3:57:57 PM PDT by 1rudeboy [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 23 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger That's it. Let's hold the religious group responsible. American justice circa 2006...
Perhaps someone should tell the Secret Service that we don't make a $1 million dollar bill these days. You'd think they might know that.
Sorry, I can't support this lunatic enforcement exercise.
33 posted on 06/02/2006 4:11:26 PM PDT by DoughtyOne (Hey Senators, what have you done with those Conservatives we sent to Congress? (CyberAnt Inspired)) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger How dare they countefiet a $2001 dollar bill. I'm telling...
LMAO
34 posted on 06/02/2006 4:12:52 PM PDT by DoughtyOne (Hey Senators, what have you done with those Conservatives we sent to Congress? (CyberAnt Inspired)) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 12 | View Replies ] To: gocats Well .. the Secret Service doesn't take it lightly when people make funny money which so closely resembles the real kind.
As for monopoly money .. it doesn't resemble REAL money at all. The size is different, the color is different, etc., so your analygy doesn't work.
But .. when a person mistakes the money for REAL stuff .. there's a problem .. the money looks too good .. and can be mistaken for the REAL stuff.
35 posted on 06/02/2006 4:15:14 PM PDT by CyberAnt (Drive-by Media: Fake news, fake documents, fake polls) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 23 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger Try the Treasury Dept - or the US Mint.
36 posted on 06/02/2006 4:16:19 PM PDT by CyberAnt (Drive-by Media: Fake news, fake documents, fake polls) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 19 | View Replies ] To: Free Baptist Well .. I've never heard of the $5 bill idea .. and to me it smells of deception .. which is the last think I want in a track when witnessing to people.
37 posted on 06/02/2006 4:17:58 PM PDT by CyberAnt (Drive-by Media: Fake news, fake documents, fake polls) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 18 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger Saw one of these the other day. Looks quite real at first glance.
38 posted on 06/02/2006 4:20:21 PM PDT by OldFriend (I Pledge Allegiance to the Flag.....and My Heart to the Soldier Who Protects It.) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 4 | View Replies ] To: Free Baptist This has been done by Gospel tract ministries for at least 50 years, and probably longer. You can still TODAY order tracts that appear, at a distance, to be folded $5.00 bills. The idea is to leave one on a table or on a counter in, say, a shopping area or a fast food restaurant. I remember getting those instead of tips when I was a waiter--Bible study groups in particular left them. It's one of the least effective outreach tools, because all it does is convince waiters and waitresses that Christians are lousy tippers. 39 posted on 06/02/2006 4:21:12 PM PDT by BeHoldAPaleHorse ( ~()):~)>) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 18 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger My husband bought a stack of tracts from www.livingwaters.com several years ago -- they look like $100 dollar bills (Ben Franklin), except they're 18"long and 6"tall! Their mission statement is printed over Independence Hall. We gave them out at Halloween -- wrapped around full-sized candy bars -- and have about a dozen left.
A person would have to be a total burbling moron to cash this thing.
Now that I think of it, there seems to be a growing population of those types in the USA these days...
40 posted on 06/02/2006 4:25:15 PM PDT by Kieri (Dump"Dangerously Incompetent"Debbie, Support Keith Butler for Senate) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: CyberAnt I agree. I'm a Christian but the few times I have seen these I have felt like I was tricked and hoped no one watching and laughing. Tape real money to tracks. That would make a better impact, I think.
41 posted on 06/02/2006 4:32:25 PM PDT by CindyDawg [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 37 | View Replies ] To: gocats §491. Tokens or paper used as money (a) Whoever, being 18 years of age or over, not lawfully authorized, makes, issues, or passes any coin, card, token, or device in metal, or its compounds, intended to be used as money, or whoever, being 18 years of age or over, with intent to defraud, makes, utters, inserts, or uses any card, token, slug, disk, device, paper, or other thing similar in size and shape to any of the lawful coins or other currency of the United States or any coin or other currency not legal tender in the United States, to procure anything of value, or the use or enjoyment of any property or service from any automatic merchandise vending machine, postage-stamp machine, turnstile, fare box, coinbox telephone, parking meter or other lawful receptacle, depository, or contrivance designed to receive or to be operated by lawful coins or other currency of the United States, shall be fined under this title, or imprisoned not more than one year, or both. (b) Whoever manufactures, sells, offers, or advertises for sale, or exposes or keeps with intent to furnish or sell any token, slug, disk, device, paper, or other thing similar in size and shape to any of the lawful coins or other currency of the United States, or any token, disk, paper, or other device issued or authorized in connection with rationing or food and fiber distribution by any agency of the United States, with knowledge or reason to believe that such tokens, slugs, disks, devices, papers, or other things are intended to be used unlawfully or fraudulently to procure anything of value, or the use or enjoyment of any property or service from any automatic merchandise vending machine, postage-stamp machine, turnstile, fare box, coinbox telephone, parking meter, or other lawful receptacle, depository, or contrivance designed to receive or to be operated by lawful coins or other currency of the United States shall be fined under this title or imprisoned not more than one year, or both. Nothing contained in this section shall create immunity from criminal prosecution under the laws of any State, Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, territory, possession, or the District of Columbia. (c)Knowledge or reason to believe, within the meaning of paragraph (b) of this section, may be shown by proof that any law-enforcement officer has, prior to the commission of the offense with which the defendant is charged, informed the defendant that tokens, slugs, disks, or other devices of the kind manufactured, sold, offered, or advertised for sale by him or exposed or kept with intent to furnish or sell, are being used unlawfully or fraudulently to operate certain specified automatic merchandise vending machines, postage-stamp machines, turnstiles, fare boxes, coin-box telephones, parking meters, or other receptacles, depositories, or contrivances, designed to receive or to be operated by lawful coins of the United States. 42 posted on 06/02/2006 4:38:12 PM PDT by Lurking in Kansas (Nothing witty here move on.) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 23 | View Replies ] To: CyberAnt As for monopoly money .. it doesn't resemble REAL money at all. The size is different, the color is different, etc., so your analygy doesn't work. But .. when a person mistakes the money for REAL stuff .. there's a problem .. the money looks too good .. and can be mistaken for the REAL stuff. What about the time someone tried to deposit Monopoly money in a bank? :^) 43 posted on 06/02/2006 4:39:41 PM PDT by TheDon (The Democratic Party is the party of TREASON!) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 35 | View Replies ] To: TheDon Now you're just being stupid!
44 posted on 06/02/2006 4:44:10 PM PDT by CyberAnt (Drive-by Media: Fake news, fake documents, fake polls) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 43 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger There were many fake bills made with Clinton's picture on them.
45 posted on 06/02/2006 4:58:17 PM PDT by Retired Chemist [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 12 | View Replies ] To: CindyDawg Tape real money to tracks. That would make a better impact, I think. Especially on railroad tracks. 46 posted on 06/02/2006 4:59:56 PM PDT by Wormwood (I! I! Cthulhu fhtagn!) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 41 | View Replies ] To: DaveLoneRanger What are the physical dimensions of these things?
47 posted on 06/02/2006 5:02:03 PM PDT by Petronski (I just love that woman.) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 1 | View Replies ] To: CindyDawg Tape real money to tracks . That would make a better impact, I think. Quite an impact, no doubt. 48 posted on 06/02/2006 5:03:41 PM PDT by Young Scholar [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 41 | View Replies ] To: Lurking in Kansas §474. Plates, stones, or analog, digital, or electronic images for counterfeiting obligations or securities (a) Whoever, having control, custody, or possession of any plate, stone, or other thing, or any part thereof, from which has been printed, or which may be prepared by direction of the Secretary of the Treasury for the purpose of printing, any obligation or other security of the United States, uses such plate, stone, or other thing, or any part thereof, or knowingly suffers the same to be used for the purpose of printing any such or similar obligation or other security, or any part thereof, except as may be printed for the use of the United States by order of the proper officer thereof; or Whoever makes or executes any plate, stone, or other thing in the likeness of any plate designated for the printing of such obligation or other security; or Whoever, with intent to defraud, makes, executes, acquires, scans, captures, records, receives, transmits, reproduces, sells, or has in such persons control, custody, or possession, an analog, digital, or electronic image of any obligation or other security of the United States; or Whoever sells any such plate, stone, or other thing, or brings into the United States any such plate, stone, or other thing, except under the direction of the Secretary of the Treasury or other proper officer, or with any other intent, in either case, than that such plate, stone, or other thing be used for the printing of the obligations or other securities of the United States; or Whoever has in his control, custody, or possession any plate, stone, or other thing in any manner made after or in the similitude of any plate, stone, or other thing, from which any such obligation or other security has been printed, with intent to use such plate, stone, or other thing, or to suffer the same to be used in forging or counterfeiting any such obligation or other security, or any part thereof; or Whoever has in his possession or custody, except under authority from the Secretary of the Treasury or other proper officer, any obligation or other security made or executed, in whole or in part, after the similitude of any obligation or other security issued under the authority of the United States, with intent to sell or otherwise use the same; or Whoever prints, photographs, or in any other manner makes or executes any engraving, photograph, print, or impression in the likeness of any such obligation or other security, or any part thereof, or sells any such engraving, photograph, print, or impression, except to the United States, or brings into the United States, any such engraving, photograph, print, or impression, except by direction of some proper officer of the United StatesIs guilty of a class B felony. (b) For purposes of this section, the termanalog, digital, or electronic imageincludes any analog, digital, or electronic method used for the making, execution, acquisition, scanning, capturing, recording, retrieval, transmission, or reproduction of any obligation or security, unless such use is authorized by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary shall establish a system (pursuant to section 504) to ensure that the legitimate use of such electronic methods and retention of such reproductions by businesses, hobbyists, press and others shall not be unduly restricted. 49 posted on 06/02/2006 5:03:43 PM PDT by Lurking in Kansas (Nothing witty here move on.) [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 42 | View Replies ] To: BeHoldAPaleHorse I remember getting those instead of tips when I was a waiter--Bible study groups in particular left them. What a bunch of idiots. 50 posted on 06/02/2006 5:04:47 PM PDT by Young Scholar [ Post Reply | Private Reply | To 39 | View Replies ] Navigation: use the links below to view more comments. first 1-50 , 51-100 , 101-103 next last Disclaimer: Opinions posted on Free Republic are those of the individual posters and do not necessarily represent the opinion of Free Republic or its management.
